information: Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: 14 days until the June 17, 2025 Democratic primary, with results expected within days afterward
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Jay Jones appears positioned to win but faces competitive opposition from Shannon Taylor in the Democratic primary
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Shannon Taylor wins by leveraging her direct prosecutorial experience as a Commonwealth's Attorney, which resonates more with Democratic voters seeking someone with hands-on legal experience for the Attorney General position. She could also benefit from strong turnout in Northern Virginia where she serves as Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Jay Jones wins by capitalizing on his impressive establishment support from two former governors (McAuliffe and Northam) and U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. His endorsements translate into superior campaign infrastructure, fundraising, and voter mobilization in the final two weeks, allowing him to win the primary with a comfortable margin.
forecast.rationale: With only 14 days until the primary election, the race is in its final stage where early voting may have already begun. Jay Jones's endorsements from former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, plus U.S. Representative Bobby Scott, represent significant establishment support within Virginia's Democratic Party. These endorsements typically provide advantages in fundraising, campaign organization, and voter mobilizationâ€”all critical factors this close to election day. However, Shannon Taylor presents credible opposition with her background as Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney, giving her direct prosecutorial experience highly relevant to the Attorney General position. The lack of polling data creates significant uncertainty. Primary electorates can be unpredictable, and credentials-based arguments (like Taylor's prosecutorial experience) can sometimes trump establishment support. Jones's previous service in the Virginia House of Delegates and family political connections provide name recognition, but this isn't guaranteed to translate to victory. I'm weighing the substantial value of Jones's high-profile endorsements (likely indicating better campaign infrastructure at this late stage) against the uncertainty inherent in any competitive primary without polling data. My forecast would be higher with polling showing a Jones lead or evidence of fundraising/organizational advantages. It would be lower if polls showed a tied race or if there were additional strong candidates fragmenting the vote.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Jerrauld "Jay" Jones win the Democratic primary for attorney general of Virginia in the 2025 election?

Question background:
Washington Post: [Former Del. Jay Jones (D) of Norfolk ramps up bid for Virginia AG](https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2024/11/12/virginia-jones-miyares-ag-election/)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if [Jerrauld "Jay" Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jay_Jones_(politician)) wins the 2025 Democratic primary for Attorney General of Virginia, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).

The Democratic primary election is currently scheduled for June 17, 2025. If there is no Democratic primary held before June 30, 2025, the question will be **annulled**.


Your research assistant's report says:
Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

Today is 2025-06-03.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
